intro: Standleyacanthus costaricanus, commonly known as the Costa Rican acanthus, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, palmate leaves and vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and mountainous regions. Its botanical features include hairy stems and a woody base, which contribute to its adaptability in humid climates. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
